title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to W. Storer How, January 31, 1866
summary: Tukey's monthly report summarizes the condition of blacks in Augusta County. In the report he discusses the practice of making employment contracts, the "flourishing" state of schools, and attacks against the Bureau in the newspaper, The Valley Virginian. Tukey also gives the details of the Walton case, in which Walton refused to abide by a court decision against him. Tukey recommends that he be arrested and sent to Richmond to demonstrate that laws and court decisions will be enforced.
